title: Understanding Stimulant Misuse
text: Stimulants can have severe effects on the body and mind when misused. Consider both psychological and physical symptoms.

title: Psychological Effects
text: Think about how stimulants can affect a person's mental state. What psychological symptoms might occur?

title: Physical Effects
text: Stimulants can also have significant physical effects. Consider how they might impact the body's systems.

hintAnswer: paranoia, hallucinations, and agitation, along with elevated body temperature, cardiac dysrhythmias, altered blood pressure, and seizures
title: Identifying Symptoms
text: List some symptoms that are commonly associated with stimulant misuse.
choices: when the person continues to use substances, the neurotransmitters adapt, and the person demonstrates a reduced response to the substance and requires more of the substance to feel an effect; this is called tolerance (U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
paranoia, hallucinations, and agitation, along with elevated body temperature, cardiac dysrhythmias, altered blood pressure, and seizures
repeated use of alcohol and/or other drugs significantly impairs a person’s health and results in an inability for them to meet major responsibilities at work, school, or home
a psychoactive compound with the potential for dependence and detrimental effects
the person begins to feel physical or emotional upset when they are not using a substance
